snippet: As more victims point to taxi drivers who had shuttled them to clients and taken a cut of their profits, the City Council is moving to raise fines and demand education on the issue.
abstract: New York City Council plans to pass legislation that would raise fines on cabdrivers who knowingly shuttle sex trafficking victims, and would direct the Taxi and Limousine Commission to educate drivers about the issue; bill is part of what Speaker Christine C Quinn says is broader effort to curb sex trafficking in New York City.
lead_paragraph: As more victims point to taxi drivers who had shuttled them to clients and taken a cut of their profits, the City Council is moving to raise fines and demand education on the issue.

headline.seo: City Plans to Target Cabdrivers Who Join in Sex Trafficking
headline.main: City Plans to Target Cabdrivers Who Join in Sex Trafficking
headline.print_headline: City Takes Aim at Cabbies in Sex Trafficking
